thread.title: Trumansburg volleyball finishes another perfect season
thread.title_full: Trumansburg volleyball finishes another perfect season

title: Trumansburg volleyball finishes another perfect season
text:
Trumansburg volleyball finishes another perfect season Tom Fleischman, tfleischman@ithacajournal.com | @TomF_IJSports 1:09 p.m. EDT October 22, 2015 The Blue Raiders completed their third consecutive unbeaten regular season on Wednesday with a straight-sets defeat of Moravia. T-burg and Moravia will both host IAC championship matches. Multi-sport. Story Highlights Trumansburg has won 49 straight regular-season volleyball matches over the past three years Dryden fell to Susquehanna Valley, 2-1 in OT, in the Section 4 Class B boys soccer quarterfinals Spencer-Van Etten will face top-seeded Elmira Notre Dame on Tuesday in the Class C quarterfinals Groton and Lansing will meet on Friday in one of four Section 4 Class C girls' soccer quarterfinals CONNECT 4 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The Trumansburg volleyball team wrapped up its third consecutive undefeated regular season on Wednesday with a straight-sets victory over Moravia in Interscholastic Athletic Conference play at Somerville Gym in Trumansburg. 
Game scores were 25-20, 25-18 and 25-9. Coach Angela McLennan's Blue Raiders (17-0 overall, 14-0 IAC) were led by senior Taylor Murphy's 12 kills and six digs, along with classmate Chloe Mount's 22 assists, three kills and two aces. 
Moravia (10-4 IAC) was led by Autumn Wells' six kills, six digs and two aces, and Ashley Justian's five kills, three digs and one block. 
Both schools will play host to their respective IAC championship matches, scheduled for Tuesday evening. North champ Trumansburg, which has won 49 straight matches over the last three regular seasons, faces South winner Watkins Glen (12-3) in the best-of-5 IAC Large School finals. Moravia will host South Division champ Tioga (15-0) for the Small School crown; the action at both sites will begin with best-of-3 JV championship matches at 5 p.m. 
Boys soccer 
Susquehanna Valley 2, Dryden 1 (OT): On Wednesday in Conklin, Jon Schultze scored the winner 22 seconds into the first overtime to lift the third-seeded Sabers to a Section 4 Class B quarterfinal victory over the Purple Lions. 
Following a four-pass sequence off the opening kickoff in overtime, Schultze received a crossing pass from Kam Chamberlain before scoring the winner. 
SV’s Corbett Pierce opened the scoring 1:56 before halftime. He scored on a rebound after Nick Terry’s initial shot was saved. 
Sixth-seeded Dryden (8-7-1) tied it late in regulation on a goal by Felix Abel-Ferretti. 
SV (8-6) will travel to Windsor for a sectional semifinal Wednesday. The Sabers defeated the Black Knights, 3-1, early in the season. 
Windsor 3, Union Springs/Port Byron 0: On Wednesday at Windsor, the second-seeded Black Knights (9-4-1) advanced to the semifinals for the first time in program history after defeating the seventh-seeded Wolves in a Class B quarterfinal. 
Hunter VanNoy opened the scoring just 10 minutes into play. A goal kick from Black Knights keeper Noah Frear (4 saves) made it through to the Wolves’ side of the field, where VanNoy chipped it in the net. Ricardo Sanabria extended the lead to 2-0 with seven minutes left in the first half, converting a set play from Sebastian Wells. 
Cade Horton capped the scoring on a free kick outside the penalty box with seven minutes left. 
Spencer-Van Etten 2, Unatego 1: On Wednesday at Unatego, ninth seed Spencer-Van Etten upended eighth seed Unatego in a Class C first-round game. 
The Panthers (9-6) travel to Elmira on Saturday to meet top-seeded Notre Dame (15-0) in the quarterfinals. Game time is 1 p.m. 
Saturday's other quarterfinal matchups included No. 2 seed Lansing (14-1-1) hosting seventh seed Marathon (12-3), third seed Greene (14-1) hosting sixth seed Delhi (14-2) and fourth seed Tioga (12-3) hosting fifth seed Trumansburg (10-4-2). The games at Lansing and Greene will kick off at 3:30 p.m.; the Trumansburg-Tioga game is scheduled for 1 p.m. 
Girls soccer 
Class C quarterfinals: On Friday, Interscholastic Athletic Conference rivals Groton and Lansing will square off in Lansing for the right to play in Tuesday's semifinals. 
The second-seeded Bobcats (11-4-1) — whose last game was the IAC tie-breaker loss, 2-1, to eventual Large School champion Dryden on Oct. 15 — are looking to repeat as sectional champions after advancing all the way to the state title game a year ago. The Bobcats defeated Groton, 7-1, in the teams' only regular-season meeting, on Sept. 3 in Lansing. 
The Bobcats' four losses all came to schools in higher classifications: They lost to Class AA squads Cicero-North Syracuse and Baldwinsville in a mid-season trip to the Syracuse area, then lost to Class B Dryden twice — in the IAC regular-season finale and again three days later in the Large North Division tie-breaker. 
Friday's other three quarterfinal matchups all involve one IAC school. Top seed Elmira Notre Dame hosts ninth seed Sidney, fourth seed Trumansburg hosts 12th seed Bainbridge-Guilford, and sixth seed Marathon travels to No. 3 seed Unadilla Valley. The semifinals are Tuesday at the home of the higher remaining seeds, with the final slated for Friday, Oct. 30, in Norwich. Read or Share this story: http://ithacajr.nl/1RYVECV TOP VIDEOS
